# WKExtendedRuntimeSessionState.scheduled

**Case**

The app has scheduled the session to run at a future date.

## Declaration

```swift
case scheduled
```

## Discussion

The session transitions to the [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKExtendedRuntimeSessionState/scheduled] state when you call the [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKExtendedRuntimeSession/start(at:)] method. It remains in this state until the start date arrives. Then it transitions to the running state.

## Session States

- **WKExtendedRuntimeSessionState.notStarted**: The app has not yet started or scheduled the session.
- **WKExtendedRuntimeSessionState.running**: The session is actively running.
- **WKExtendedRuntimeSessionState.invalid**: Either the session has encountered an error, or it has stopped running.
